questionText: What happens to an object in IOTA when it is made immutable?

answerOptions.answerText: It can still be mutated but not transferred.
It becomes owner-less and cannot be mutated, transferred, or deleted.
It can be transferred but not mutated.
It is deleted from the network.

questionText: Which function is used to make an object immutable in IOTA?
After an object is made immutable in IOTA, who can access it?

answerOptions.answerText: Anyone on the network can access it as a read-only reference.

questionText: Can an immutable object in IOTA be mutated or deleted after being frozen?

answerOptions.answerText: Yes, but only by the owner.
No, it cannot be mutated, transferred, or deleted.
Yes, but only by network administrators.
